description.narrative: The Australian Civilian Corps (ACC) is a whole of government initiative that enables the deployment of skilled civilians to help countries experiencing or emerging from natural disaster or conflict. The deployment of an ACC Learning and Development Officer to the Regional Anti-Piracy Prosecution and Intelligence Coordination Centre (RAPPICC) in Victoria, Republic of Seychelles will assist in the provision of training and mentoring to develop theoretical knowledge and technical skills related to their specific intelligence and prosecutorial roles. The officer will be responsible for overseeing the performance development and training requirements of RAPPICC officers and will act as an interface between line-management, partner training agencies as well as assist and manage the delivery of training. The total value of this initiative is $0.4 million over 2 years, starting 2012-13.
